title: Skydiver day
text:
Skydiver day is an unofficial holiday of <a href="skydiver">skydiver</a>s, annually celebrated on 26 July in some countries, such as <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>, <a href="Kazakhstan">Kazakhstan</a>, <a href="Belarus">Belarus</a>, and <a href="Russia">Russia</a>. In <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>, skydiver day is celebrated on 22 October.
History.
In 1929, <a href="Red%20Army">RA</a> <a href="kombrig">kombrig</a> <a href="Leonid%20Minov">Leonid Minov</a> within the trading organization <a href="Amtorg%20Trading%20Corporation">Amtorg Trading Corporation</a> had visited the <a href="IRVIN-GQ">IRVIN-GQ</a> factory, which produced the emergency <a href="parachute">parachute</a>s, and performed several jumps. After returning to the <a href="USSR">USSR</a> he was appointed to the Skydiving instructor position of the <a href="air%20force">air force</a>s of <a href="Red%20Army">RA</a>. He had performed a theoretical preparation for 30 volunteers of the 11th aviation crew of Moscow military district.
On 26 July, near Voronizh five <a href="USSR">USSR</a> pilots and mechanics (Moshkovsky, Yegorov, Zakharov, Kovalenkov, Kukharenko, Mukhin, Povalyaev, Poydus, Fillipov, Freidman, Cherkashyn), headed by <a href="Leonid%20Minov">Leonid Minov</a>, had performed the first training series of jumps from the <a href="Airplane">plane</a> in the history of the <a href="USSR">USSR</a>. The <a href="parachute">parachute</a>s used for jumps were produced by American company <a href="IRVIN-GQ">IRVIN-GQ</a>, and were bought by <a href="Leonid%20Minov">Leonid Minov</a> during his visit to the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. In total, there were 59 jumps performed during the trainings from the period from 26 to 29 July. The first experience in 1930 propelled the further development of <a href="skydiving">skydiving</a> in the <a href="USSR">USSR</a>. There were around 600 jumps performed from 1930 till the end of 1931. The enthusiasm was so high that many <a href="skydiving%20towers">skydiving towers</a> were built in city parks so anyone could perform jumps there.
